intro: Caraipa aracaensis, commonly known as the Araçá-do-Ceará, is a small evergreen tree native to the northeastern region of Brazil. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes other economically important plants like eucalyptus and guava. The plant is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves and small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruit is a small, red, fleshy drupe that contains a single seed. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
